name=search_term_string"}],"inLanguage":"en-US"},{"@type":"Organization","@id":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/#organization","name":"TechCrunch","alternateName":"TC","url":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/","logo":{"@type":"ImageObject","inLanguage":"en-US","@id":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/#\/schema\/logo\/image\/","url":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/04\/tc-logo-2018-square-reverse2x.png?resize=1200,1200","contentUrl":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/04\/tc-logo-2018-square-reverse2x.png?resize=1200,1200","width":1200,"height":1200,"caption":"TechCrunch"},"image":{"@id":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/#\/schema\/logo\/image\/"},"sameAs":["https:\/\/www.facebook.com\/techcrunch","https:\/\/twitter.com\/TechCrunch","https:\/\/mstdn.social\/@TechCrunch","https:\/\/bsky.app\/profile\/techcrunch.bsky.social","https:\/\/www.threads.net\/@techcrunch"]}]}},"_links":{"self":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tags\/449549899"}],"collection":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tags"}],"about":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/taxonomies\/post_tag"}],"wp:post_type":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/posts?tags=449549899"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc_battlefield?tags=449549899"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc-media-gallery?tags=449549899"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc_unified_video?tags=449549899"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc_video?tags=449549899"}],"curies":[{"name":"wp","href":"https:\/\/api.w.org\/{rel}","templated":true}]}}],[],[],[],[],[]]}},{"id":2609537,"date":"2023-10-03T13:27:41","date_gmt":"2023-10-03T20:27:41","guid":{"rendered":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/?p=2609537"},"modified":"2023-10-03T14:04:39","modified_gmt":"2023-10-03T21:04:39","slug":"how-an-ai-deepfake-ad-of-mrbeast-ended-up-on-tiktok","status":"publish","type":"post","link":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2023\/10\/03\/how-an-ai-deepfake-ad-of-mrbeast-ended-up-on-tiktok\/","title":{"rendered":"How an AI deepfake ad of MrBeast ended up on TikTok"},"content":{"rendered":" "speakable-summary\">AI deepfakes are getting so good that a fraudulent MrBeast ad slipped past TikTok’s ad moderation technology to end up on the platform.<\/p>\n In the "https:\/\/twitter.com\/MrBeast\/status\/1709046466629554577\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">ad<\/a>, the massively influential creator appeared to be offering 10,000 viewers an "https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2023\/09\/19\/apples-iphone-15-pro-max-goes-to-disneyland\/\"> iPhone 15 Pro<\/a> for just $2. In most cases, this would be a clear indication of a scam, but coming from MrBeast, it could actually be believable.<\/p>\n MrBeast (a 25-year-old named Jimmy Donaldson with more subscribers than any other individual on YouTube) got famous by creating increasingly absurd stunt videos in which he gives people free homes and cars with no strings attached (so long as they agree to be in his video). Or, more recently, he’ll ask people from “ "https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2023\/08\/22\/mrbeast-olympics-every-country-youtube-geopolitical-nightmare\/\">every country on Earth<\/a>” to compete for a $250,000 prize in a series of Olympic-like mini games.<\/p>\n So, if you’re not particularly privy to spotting scams, and you’re scrolling TikTok late at night when you’re not thinking straight, it could be within the realm of possibility that MrBeast would buy 10,000 iPhones to give away via TikTok ad. After all, he "https:\/\/www.youtube.com\/shorts\/YlvcFJOE-OE\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">literally<\/a> has given away free iPhones to unsuspecting trick or treaters.<\/p>\n "embed breakout embed-oembed embed--twitter\">\n "twitter-tweet\" data-width=\"550\" data-dnt=\"true\">\n "en\" dir=\"ltr\">Lots of people are getting this deepfake scam ad of me\u2026 are social media platforms ready to handle the rise of AI deepfakes? This is a serious problem "https:\/\/t.co\/llkhxswQSw\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">pic.twitter.com\/llkhxswQSw<\/a><\/p>\n — MrBeast (@MrBeast) "https:\/\/twitter.com\/MrBeast\/status\/1709046466629554577?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">October 3, 2023<\/a><\/p><\/blockquote>\n "https:\/\/platform.twitter.com\/widgets.js\" charset=\"utf-8\"><\/script><\/div>\n To be charitable, this could explain how the deepfake ad got approved on TikTok. TikTok uses a mixture of human moderation and — ironically enough — AI-aided technology to review ads before they post. So, essentially, TikTok’s AI battled against the AI behind this MrBeast deepfake and lost.<\/p> "piano-inline-promo\"><\/div>\n TikTok told TechCrunch that it removed the ad within a few hours of being posted, because it violated TikTok’s advertising policies. TikTok doesn’t wholly prohibit advertisers from using synthetic or manipulated media, but the platform requires that advertisers very clearly disclose if they are using this kind of technology.<\/p>\n TikTok isn’t unique in its use of AI to moderate advertisements. Meta "https:\/\/www.facebook.com\/business\/help\/204798856225114?id=649869995454285\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">says<\/a> it relies “primarily on automated technology,” but similar to TikTok, it uses human reviewers to train its AI and sometimes manually reviews ads.<\/p>\n "embed breakout embed-oembed embed--instagram\">\n "instagram-media\" data-instgrm-captioned data-instgrm-permalink=\"https:\/\/www.instagram.com\/p\/Cx54IIFuozI\/?utm_source=ig_embed&utm_campaign=loading\" data-instgrm-version=\"14\" style=\" background:#FFF; border:0; border-radius:3px; box-shadow:0 0 1px 0 rgba(0,0,0,0.5),0 1px 10px 0 rgba(0,0,0,0.15); margin: 1px; max-width:658px; min-width:326px; padding:0; width:99.375%; width:-webkit-calc(100% - 2px); width:calc(100% - border-right: 8px solid transparent; transform: translateY(16px);\"><\/div>\n " background-color: #F4F4F4; flex-grow: 0; height: 12px; width: 16px; transform: translateY(-4px);\"><\/div>\n " width: 0; height: 0; border-top: 8px solid #F4F4F4; border-left: 8px solid transparent; transform: translateY(-4px) translateX(8px);\"><\/div>\n<\/div>\n<\/div>\n "display: flex; flex-direction: column; flex-grow: 1; justify-content: center; margin-bottom: 24px;\">\n " background-color: #F4F4F4; border-radius: 4px; flex-grow: 0; height: 14px; margin-bottom: 6px; width: 224px;\"><\/div>\n " background-color: #F4F4F4; border-radius: 4px; flex-grow: 0; height: 14px; width: 144px;\"><\/div>\n<\/div>\n <\/a><\/p>\n " color:#c9c8cd; font-family:Arial,sans-serif; font-size:14px; line-height:17px; margin-bottom:0; margin-top:8px; overflow:hidden; padding:8px 0 7px; text-align:center; text-overflow:ellipsis; white-space:nowrap;\"> "https:\/\/www.instagram.com\/p\/Cx54IIFuozI\/?utm_source=ig_embed&utm_campaign=loading\" style=\" color:#c9c8cd; font-family:Arial,sans-serif; font-size:14px; font-style:normal; font-weight:normal; line-height:17px; text-decoration:none;\" target=\"_blank\">A post shared by Gayle King (@gayleking)<\/a><\/p>\n<\/div>\n<\/blockquote>\n "\/\/platform.instagram.com\/en_US\/embeds.js\"><\/script><\/div>\n Deceptive deepfakes aren’t new, but as AI becomes especially trendy among investors and consumers alike, the technology is becoming easier than ever to access. While internet famous celebrities like MrBeast appeal to younger generations, older consumers are being fooled too. This week alone, actor Tom Hanks and CBS anchor Gayle King both warned their followers that they’re being deepfaked into fraudulent ads.<\/p>\n “BEWARE!!” wrote Tom Hanks on "https:\/\/www.instagram.com\/p\/Cx2MsH9rt7q\/?hl=en\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Instagram<\/a>. “There’s a video out there promoting some dental plan with an AI version of me. I have nothing to do with it.”<\/p>\n The FTC has already issued "https:\/\/www.ftc.gov\/business-guidance\/blog\/2023\/03\/chatbots-deepfakes-voice-clones-ai-deception-sale\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">warnings<\/a> about deepfake marketing, but the practice has proven hard to regulate at scale. And as global elections "https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2023\/09\/26\/generative-ai-disinformation-risks\/\">loom<\/a>, the consequences of this deceptive advertising could become more dire.<\/p>\n "embed breakout embed-oembed embed--techcrunch\">\n "wp-embedded-content\" data-secret=\"ymjSzBeq1g\"> "https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2023\/09\/08\/how-badly-will-ai-generated-images-impact-elections\/\">How badly will AI-generated images impact elections?<\/a><\/p><\/blockquote>\n "wp-embedded-content\" sandbox=\"allow-scripts\" security=\"restricted\" style=\"position: absolute; clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);\" title=\"“How badly will AI-generated images impact elections?” — TechCrunch\" src=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2023\/09\/08\/how-badly-will-ai-generated-images-impact-elections\/embed\/#?secret=IZucqdtffj#?secret=ymjSzBeq1g\" data-secret=\"ymjSzBeq1g\" width=\"800\" height=\"450\" frameborder=\"0\" marginwidth=\"0\" marginheight=\"0\" scrolling=\"no\"><\/iframe><\/div>\n "embed breakout embed-oembed embed--techcrunch\">\n "wp-embedded-content\" data-secret=\"fDN1qW2feX\"> "https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2023\/09\/26\/generative-ai-disinformation-risks\/\">Deepfake election risks trigger EU call for more generative AI safeguards<\/a><\/p><\/blockquote>\n "wp-embedded-content\" sandbox=\"allow-scripts\" security=\"restricted\" style=\"position: absolute; clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);\" title=\"“Deepfake election risks trigger EU call for more generative AI safeguards” — TechCrunch\" src=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2023\/09\/26\/generative-ai-disinformation-risks\/embed\/#?secret=ncwwRApPk3#?secret=fDN1qW2feX\" data-secret=\"fDN1qW2feX\" width=\"800\" height=\"450\" frameborder=\"0\" marginwidth=\"0\" marginheight=\"0\" scrolling=\"no\"><\/iframe><\/div>\n","protected":false},"excerpt":{"rendered":" AI deepfakes are getting so good that a fraudulent MrBeast ad slipped past TikTok’s ad moderation technology to end up on the platform. In the ad, the massively influential creator appeared to be offering 10,000 viewers an iPhone 15 Pro for just $2. twitter-has-paid-almost-20m-to-creators-ceo-says\/","title":{"rendered":"X (Twitter) has paid almost $20M to creators, CEO says"},"content":{"rendered":" "speakable-summary\">The company formerly known as Twitter has paid out nearly "https:\/\/twitter.com\/lindayaX\/status\/1707760854307889323\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\u00a0$20 million<\/a> to creators, according to a post from X CEO Linda Yaccarino.<\/p>\n The platform, now called X, began paying creators in July for a share of the ad revenue they earned from ads served in the replies to their posts to other verified users. To be eligible, users must subscribe to X Premium (which is the new name for Twitter Blue, not a porn site), have more than 500 followers and have earned more than 5 million tweet impressions for the last three months.<\/p>\n "embed breakout embed-oembed embed--twitter\">\n "twitter-tweet\" data-width=\"550\" data-dnt=\"true\">\n "en\" dir=\"ltr\">Create. Connect. Collect all on X. We\u2019re enabling the economic success of new segments like creators. And so far we've paid out almost $20 million to our creator community.
"https:\/\/t.co\/kk137uPkAo\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">https:\/\/t.co\/kk137uPkAo<\/a><\/p>\n — Linda Yaccarino (@lindayaX) "https:\/\/twitter.com\/lindayaX\/status\/1707760854307889323?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">September 29, 2023<\/a><\/p><\/blockquote>\n "https:\/\/platform.twitter.com\/widgets.js\" charset=\"utf-8\"><\/script><\/div>\n The first payments in July, which were cumulative from February onward, totaled around "https:\/\/twitter.com\/elonmusk\/status\/1667314848856948736?\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">$5 million<\/a>, according to owner Elon Musk. If X has now paid $20 million, that would mean that substantially more creators have joined the creator program, or that X ads are generating more impressions.<\/p>\n Creators are also now incentivized to get users to reply to their tweets. While this could inspire conversation, we know from platforms like "https:\/\/www.washingtonpost.com\/technology\/2021\/10\/26\/facebook-angry-emoji-algorithm\/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" data-mrf-link=\"https:\/\/www.washingtonpost.com\/technology\/2021\/10\/26\/facebook-angry-emoji-algorithm\/\">Facebook<\/a> that extreme emotions drive the most engagement.<\/p>\n However, Twitter has been a platform deprioritized by creators since its inception, since it has been very difficult to convert a following into cash — on platforms like YouTube, creators in the partner program have been getting a share of ad revenue for over a decade. Now that creators can make money on the platform, there’s reason to subscribe to X Premium (…still not a porn site) and get posting.<\/p> "piano-inline-promo\"><\/div>\n "embed breakout embed-oembed embed--techcrunch\">\n "wp-embedded-content\" data-secret=\"WegXfipnhY\"> "https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2023\/09\/27\/x-will-be-profitable-in-2024-ceo-claims-in-tense-interview\/\">X will be profitable in 2024, CEO claims in tense interview<\/a><\/p><\/blockquote>\n "wp-embedded-content\" sandbox=\"allow-scripts\" security=\"restricted\" style=\"position: absolute; clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);\" title=\"“X will be profitable in 2024, CEO claims in tense interview” — TechCrunch\" src=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2023\/09\/27\/x-will-be-profitable-in-2024-ceo-claims-in-tense-interview\/embed\/#?secret=IEKuS08aC0#?secret=WegXfipnhY\" data-secret=\"WegXfipnhY\" width=\"800\" height=\"450\" frameborder=\"0\" marginwidth=\"0\" marginheight=\"0\" scrolling=\"no\"><\/iframe><\/div>\n "embed breakout embed-oembed embed--techcrunch\">\n "wp-embedded-content\" data-secret=\"OqmvQmAPiP\"> "https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2023\/07\/13\/twitter-starts-sharing-ad-revenue-with-verified-creators\/\">Twitter starts sharing ad revenue with verified creators<\/a><\/p><\/blockquote>\n "wp-embedded-content\" sandbox=\"allow-scripts\" security=\"restricted\" style=\"position: absolute; clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);\" title=\"“Twitter starts sharing ad revenue with verified creators” — TechCrunch\" src=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2023\/07\/13\/twitter-starts-sharing-ad-revenue-with-verified-creators\/embed\/#?secret=Ot2et0r06e#?secret=OqmvQmAPiP\" data-secret=\"OqmvQmAPiP\" width=\"800\" height=\"450\" frameborder=\"0\" marginwidth=\"0\" marginheight=\"0\" scrolling=\"no\"><\/iframe><\/div>\n","protected":false},"excerpt":{"rendered":" The company formerly known as Twitter has paid out nearly\u00a0$20 million to creators, according to a post from X CEO Linda Yaccarino. The platform, now called X, began paying creators in July for a share of the ad revenue they earned from ads served in the replies to their posts to other verified users. will be profitable in 2024, CEO claims in tense interview"},"content":{"rendered":" "speakable-summary\">According to X CEO Linda Yaccarino, the company formerly known as Twitter will be profitable by early 2024.<\/p>\n "transcript-snippet__content__body__word ng-star-inserted\" data-highlighted=\"false\" data-playhead=\"false\">“N<\/span> "transcript-snippet__content__body__word ng-star-inserted\" "transcript-snippet__content__body__word ng-star-inserted\" data-highlighted=\"false\" data-playhead=\"false\">I<\/span> "transcript-snippet__content__body__word ng-star-inserted\" "transcript-snippet__content__body__word ng-star-inserted\" data-highlighted=\"false\" data-playhead=\"false\">myself<\/span> "transcript-snippet__content__body__word ng-star-inserted\" data-highlighted=\"false\" data-playhead=\"false\">in<\/span> "transcript-snippet__content__body__word ng-star-inserted\" data-highlighted=\"false\" data-playhead=\"false\">the<\/span> "transcript-snippet__content__body__word ng-star-inserted\" data-highlighted=\"false\" data-playhead=\"false\">business,<\/span> "transcript-snippet__content__body__word ng-star-inserted\" data-highlighted=\"false\" data-playhead=\"false\">and<\/span> "transcript-snippet__content__body__word ng-star-inserted\" data-highlighted=\"false\" data-playhead=\"false\">we<\/span> "transcript-snippet__content__body__word ng-star-inserted\" data-highlighted=\"false\" data-playhead=\"false\">have<\/span> "transcript-snippet__content__body__word ng-star-inserted\" "transcript-snippet__content__body__word ng-star-inserted\" data-highlighted=\"false\" data-playhead=\"false\">set<\/span> "transcript-snippet__content__body__word ng-star-inserted\" data-highlighted=\"false\" data-playhead=\"false\">of<\/span> "transcript-snippet__content__body__word ng-star-inserted\" data-highlighted=\"false\" data-playhead=\"false\">eyes<\/span> "transcript-snippet__content__body__word ng-star-inserted\" data-highlighted=\"false\" data-playhead=\"false\">on<\/span> "transcript-snippet__content__body__word ng-star-inserted\" data-highlighted=\"false\" data-playhead=\"false\">what<\/span> "transcript-snippet__content__body__word ng-star-inserted\" data-highlighted=\"false\" data-playhead=\"false\">is<\/span> "transcript-snippet__content__body__word ng-star-inserted\" data-highlighted=\"false\" data-playhead=\"false\">predictable,<\/span>\u00a0 "transcript-snippet__content__body__word ng-star-inserted\" data-highlighted=\"false\" data-playhead=\"false\">what’s<\/span> "transcript-snippet__content__body__word ng-star-inserted\" data-highlighted=\"false\" data-playhead=\"false\">coming <\/span> "transcript-snippet__content__body__word ng-star-inserted\" data-highlighted=\"false\" data-playhead=\"false\">is<\/span> "transcript-snippet__content__body__word ng-star-inserted\" data-highlighted=\"false\" data-playhead=\"false\">that<\/span> "transcript-snippet__content__body__word ng-star-inserted\" data-highlighted=\"false\" data-playhead=\"false\">it<\/span> "transcript-snippet__content__body__word ng-star-inserted\" data-highlighted=\"false\" data-playhead=\"false\">looks<\/span> "transcript-snippet__content__body__word ng-star-inserted\" data-highlighted=\"false\" data-playhead=\"false\">like<\/span> "transcript-snippet__content__body__word ng-star-inserted\" data-highlighted=\"false\" data-playhead=\"false\">in<\/span> "transcript-snippet__content__body__word ng-star-inserted\" data-highlighted=\"false\" data-playhead=\"false\">early<\/span> ’24, we "transcript-snippet__content__body__word ng-star-inserted\" data-highlighted=\"false\" data-playhead=\"false\">will<\/span> "transcript-snippet__content__body__word ng-star-inserted\" data-highlighted=\"false\" data-playhead=\"false\">be<\/span> "transcript-snippet__content__body__word ng-star-inserted\" data-highlighted=\"false\" data-playhead=\"false\">turning<\/span> "transcript-snippet__content__body__word ng-star-inserted\" data-highlighted=\"false\" data-playhead=\"false\">a<\/span> "transcript-snippet__content__body__word ng-star-inserted\" data-highlighted=\"false\" data-playhead=\"false\">profit,” Yaccarino said onstage at the Code Conference.<\/span><\/p>\n That’s a big statement for a company that "https:\/\/www.cnn.com\/2019\/02\/07\/tech\/twitter-earnings-q4\/index.html\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">didn’t turn an annual profit<\/a> in its first 13 years, and which has struggled to maintain profitability since — let alone for a company that was bought by Elon Musk only a year ago. But these comments are consistent with Yaccarino’s previous statements across the few months since she became CEO. In August, she said on CNBC that X was “ "https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2023\/08\/10\/ceo-says-x-formerly-twitter-is-close-to-break-even\/\">pretty close to breakeven<\/a>” in terms of operational run rate. In July, she stated in a "https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2023\/07\/24\/twitter-now-x-ceo-ceo-linda-yaccarino-claims-usage-at-all-time-high-in-memo-to-staff\/\">leaked memo<\/a> that X usage was at an all-time high.<\/p>\n Yaccarino said onstage today that, “90% of the top 100 advertisers have returned to the platform in the last 12 weeks alone.”<\/p>\n X also reduced its spending by cutting the size of its staff from 8,000 to about 1,500; further, "https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2023\/02\/26\/more-layoffs-at-twitter-and-loyalist-esther-crawford-isnt-spared\/\">laid-off<\/a> employees still have not been paid severance. X is also "https:\/\/www.businessinsider.com\/elon-musk-twitter-lawsuit-he-never-planned-to-pay-rent-2023-5\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" data-mrf-link=\"https:\/\/www.businessinsider.com\/elon-musk-twitter-lawsuit-he-never-planned-to-pay-rent-2023-5\">facing<\/a>\u00a0 "https:\/\/www.theguardian.com\/technology\/2023\/jul\/03\/twitter-faces-lawsuit-over-alleged-non-payment-for-office-services-in-four-countries\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" data-mrf-link=\"https:\/\/www.theguardian.com\/technology\/2023\/jul\/03\/twitter-faces-lawsuit-over-alleged-non-payment-for-office-services-in-four-countries\">multiple<\/a>\u00a0 "https:\/\/www.sfchronicle.com\/tech\/article\/twitter-sued-by-landlord-at-s-f-hq-after-alleged-17737102.php\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" data-mrf-link=\"https:\/\/www.sfchronicle.com\/tech\/article\/twitter-sued-by-landlord-at-s-f-hq-after-alleged-17737102.php\">lawsuits<\/a> over not paying rent for office space in several countries.<\/p>\n Yaccarino added that the time users spend on X has gone up since June. But the interviewer, CNBC’s Julia Boorstin, pushed back on such claims about user engagement, pointing to data from app analytics firm Apptopia. Though Boorstin didn’t cite the specific statistics, Apptopia has recently "https:\/\/www.businessinsider.com\/twitter-downloads-usage-sinks-under-elon-musk-ownership-2023-9\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">reported<\/a> that X downloads are down 30% in the two months after its rebrand from Twitter. Apptopia also reported decreased web traffic to X, and lower user numbers since before Twitter went public.<\/p>\n Around the time that Boorstin asked about daily active users, the air between the two turned somewhat hostile. Yaccarino came onstage already on the defensive, as the Code Conference added an interview with former Twitter trust and safety head Yoel Roth to the day’s events at the last minute. Though Musk was fond of Roth at the beginning of his tenure at Twitter, Roth ended up leaving the company and was subject to serious threats and harassment, which Musk played no small part in.<\/p> "piano-inline-promo\"><\/div>\n When asked about what advice he would give to Yaccarino, Roth had more to say about her own personal safety than her management of X. He said he was taken aback by a recent profile of Yaccarino, in which she opened up about the online attacks she’s weathered in her new role.<\/p>\n “Nobody should have to experience that. Not a CEO, not a journalist, not me. Not anybody…. Look what your boss did to me,” he said, referencing Musk’s role in his harassment, which became so extreme that he had to go into "https:\/\/news.yahoo.com\/gay-ex-twitter-exec-hiding-220152917.html\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">hiding<\/a>.<\/p>\n “It happened to me. It happened after he sang my praises publicly. It happened after I didn’t attack him. I didn’t attack the company. I quietly left,” Roth said, then spoke directly to Yaccarino. “For those that you love, you should be worried. I wish I had been more worried.”<\/p>\n "embed breakout embed-oembed embed--techcrunch\">\n "wp-embedded-content\" data-secret=\"4uNJGjGniC\"> memo to staff<\/a><\/p><\/blockquote>\n "wp-embedded-content\" sandbox=\"allow-scripts\" security=\"restricted\" style=\"position: absolute; clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);\" title=\"“Twitter (now X) name=search_term_string"}],"inLanguage":"en-US"},{"@type":"Organization","@id":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/#organization","name":"TechCrunch","alternateName":"TC","url":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/","logo":{"@type":"ImageObject","inLanguage":"en-US","@id":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/#\/schema\/logo\/image\/","url":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/04\/tc-logo-2018-square-reverse2x.png?resize=1200,1200","contentUrl":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/04\/tc-logo-2018-square-reverse2x.png?resize=1200,1200","width":1200,"height":1200,"caption":"TechCrunch"},"image":{"@id":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/#\/schema\/logo\/image\/"},"sameAs":["https:\/\/www.facebook.com\/techcrunch","https:\/\/twitter.com\/TechCrunch","https:\/\/mstdn.social\/@TechCrunch","https:\/\/bsky.app\/profile\/techcrunch.bsky.social","https:\/\/www.threads.net\/@techcrunch"]}]}},"_links":{"self":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tags\/1700"}],"collection":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tags"}],"about":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/taxonomies\/post_tag"}],"wp:post_type":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/posts?tags=1700"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc_battlefield?tags=1700"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc-media-gallery?tags=1700"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc_unified_video?tags=1700"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc_video?tags=1700"}],"curies":[{"name":"wp","href":"https:\/\/api.w.org\/{rel}","templated":true}]}}],[],[],[],[],[]]}},{"id":2606768,"date":"2023-09-27T12:08:11","date_gmt":"2023-09-27T19:08:11","guid":{"rendered":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/?p=2606768"},"modified":"2023-09-27T19:06:29","modified_gmt":"2023-09-28T02:06:29","slug":"mark-zuckerberg-went-33-minutes-without-saying-metaverse-at-his-keynote","status":"publish","type":"post","link":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2023\/09\/27\/mark-zuckerberg-went-33-minutes-without-saying-metaverse-at-his-keynote\/","title":{"rendered":"Mark Zuckerberg went 33 minutes without saying ‘metaverse’ at his keynote"},"content":{"rendered":" "speakable-summary\">When Meta rebranded from Facebook two years ago, the word “metaverse” went mainstream. Even people outside the tech world wondered if we would soon start to socialize via virtual reality headsets. But at least according to public opinion and "https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2022\/10\/27\/meta-stock-yikes\/\">the stock market<\/a>, the metaverse proved itself to be pretty mid.<\/p>\n Propelled by founder and CEO Mark Zuckerberg’s ardent vision, Meta remains committed to its dreams of a world where we "https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2022\/10\/11\/metas-vision-for-the-future-of-vr-is-a-worse-version-of-the-past\/\">attend work meetings in VR<\/a> and hang out with our friends in Horizon Worlds, rather than in person. So, as Mark Zuckerberg announced the Quest 3 headset today at the "https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2023\/09\/27\/meta-connect-2023-quest-3-vr-everything-you-need-to-know\/\">Meta Connect<\/a> event, it was a surprise that he didn’t mention the metaverse.<\/p>\n No, really. Zuckerberg did not utter the word “metaverse” until 33 minutes into his Meta Connect presentation. He played a text adventure game with a Snoop Dogg\u2013inspired AI before he mentioned the metaverse. He used AI to turn his dog into origami before he mentioned the metaverse. He made numerous references to his interest in cage fighting before he mentioned the metaverse. We don’t know how much Mark took away from his Meta Connect rehearsals — he seemed a little nervous onstage — but we can guess that someone told him sternly that he cannot<\/em> talk about the metaverse. The "https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2022\/10\/26\/mark-zuckerberg-metaverse-memes\/\">bullying<\/a> would be endless.<\/p>\n When did the metaverse actually come up? After demoing a new "https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2023\/09\/27\/meta-debuts-ai-studio-to-let-developers-build-custom-chatbots\/\">slate of AI assistants<\/a> with specific personalities (which, for some reason, are depicted as celebrities like Naomi Osaka and Charli D’Amelio), Zuckerberg let us know that we will be able talk with these AIs across platforms.<\/p>\n “We’re also working on bringing all of this to the metaverse \u00a0.\u00a0.\u00a0.\u00a0where these AIs will be embodied as avatars, you’ll be able to make them as NPCs in the different games and experiences that you build in all of the different Horizon Worlds, and I think that’s gonna be really neat,” Zuckerberg said at Meta Connect today.<\/p>\n This pivot in messaging isn’t surprising — and it’s smart, given how Meta managed to make virtual reality, an inherently cool technology, "https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2022\/10\/11\/its-painful-how-hellbent-mark-zuckerberg-is-on-convincing-us-that-vr-is-a-thing\/\">extremely uncool<\/a>. This marketing shift has been foreshadowed in Meta’s last several quarterly earnings calls, where Zuckerberg has emphasized Meta’s strides in AI, while VR takes a back seat. He even had to clarify that he still is committed to the metaverse.<\/p>\n \u201cA narrative has developed that we\u2019re somehow moving away from focusing on the metaverse vision, so I just want to say up front that that\u2019s not accurate,\u201d Zuckerberg "https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2023\/04\/26\/meta-beats-revenue-expectations-remains-committed-to-metaverse\/\">said<\/a> on an earnings call in April. \u201cWe\u2019ve been focusing on AI and the metaverse, and we will continue to.\u201d<\/p> "piano-inline-promo\"><\/div>\n Though the "https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2023\/09\/27\/metas-500-quest-3-targets-consumer-mixed-reality\/\">Quest 3<\/a> makes Meta very competitive with "https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2023\/06\/05\/apple-headset\/\">Apple’s mixed-reality headset<\/a>, Reality Labs (Meta’s division for VR and AR) continues to struggle. Last quarter, Meta\u2019s VR and AR products brought in just $276 million, while Reality Labs lost "https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2023\/07\/26\/meta-earnings-q2-2023\">$3.7 billion<\/a>.<\/p>\n "https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/tag\/meta-connect-2023\"> "async\" src=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2023\/09\/meta-connect-2023-banner.png\" alt=\"Read more about Meta Connect on TechCrunch\" \/><\/a><\/p>\n","protected":false},"excerpt":{"rendered":" When Meta rebranded from Facebook two years ago, the word “metaverse” went mainstream. Even people outside the tech world wondered if we would soon start to socialize via virtual reality headsets. But at least according to public opinion and the stock market, the metaverse proved itself to be pretty mid. Propelled by founder and CEO […]<\/p>\n","protected":false},"author":133574468,"featured_media":2500001,"comment_status":"open","ping_status":"closed","sticky":false,"template":"","format":"standard","meta":{"amp_status":"","relegenceEntities":[],"relegenceSubjects":[],"carmot_uuid":"1515cd57-3940-380e-b7cc-415bf3333d24","footnotes":"","apple_news_api_created_at":"2023-09-27T19:08:20Z","apple_news_api_id":"2e4a9d87-48a1-4f65-b667-f514c695c40b","apple_news_api_modified_at":"2023-09-28T02:04:45Z","apple_news_api_revision":"AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAQ==","apple_news_api_share_url":"https:\/\/apple.news\/ALkqdh0ihT2W2Z_UUxpXECw","apple_news_coverimage":0,"apple_news_coverimage_caption":"","apple_news_is_hidden":false,"apple_news_is_paid":false,"apple_news_is_preview":false,"apple_news_is_sponsored":false,"apple_news_maturity_rating":"","apple_news_metadata":"\"\"","apple_news_pullquote":"","apple_news_pullquote_position":"","apple_news_slug":"","apple_news_sections":"\"\"","apple_news_suppress_video_url":false,"apple_news_use_image_component":false},"categories":[449223024,577055593],"tags":[577193262,577193263,576603748,577169321,18949],"crunchbase_tag":[],"tc_stories_tax":[],"tc_ec_category":[],"tc_event":[],"tc_regions_tax":[],"yoast_head":"\n Mark Zuckerberg went 33 minutes without saying 'metaverse' at his keynote | TechCrunch<\/title>\n "description\" content=\"When Meta rebranded from Facebook two years ago, the word "metaverse" went mainstream. ed":"The writers’ strike is over; here’s how AI negotiations shook out"},"content":{"rendered":" "speakable-summary\">After almost five months, the Writers Guild of America (WGA) has "https:\/\/www.wgacontract2023.org\/the-campaign\/summary-of-the-2023-wga-mba\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">reached an agreement<\/a> with Hollywood studios to end the writers’ strike. Starting Wednesday, writers will be able to resume work under the conditions established by their new contract.<\/p>\n During the historic strike, AI emerged as a key point of contention between the writers and studios. Though text-based generative AI tools like ChatGPT are very creatively limited as they stand, writers worried that studios would still try to take advantage of these fast-developing tools to avoid paying union members.<\/p>\n \u201cI\u2019m not worried about the technology,\u201d comedy writer Adam Conover "https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2023\/05\/03\/ai-replace-tv-writers-strike\/\">told TechCrunch<\/a> at the start of the strike. \u201cI\u2019m worried about the companies using technology, that is not in fact very good, to undermine our working conditions.\u201d<\/p>\n "embed breakout embed-oembed embed--techcrunch\">Along with better residual payments, minimum writers’ room staffing and other terms that help screenwriters make a living, the WGA’s new contract outlines limitations on how AI can be used in writers’ rooms.<\/div>\n Per the agreement, AI cannot be used to write or rewrite scripts, and AI-generated writing cannot be considered source material, which prevents writers from losing out on writing credits due to AI.<\/p>\n On an individual level, writers can choose to use AI tools if they so desire. However, a company cannot mandate that writers use certain AI tools while working on a production. Studios must also tell writers if they are given any AI-generated materials to incorporate into a work.<\/p>\n As the WGA’s "https:\/\/www.wgacontract2023.org\/the-campaign\/summary-of-the-2023-wga-mba\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">summary<\/a> of the contract states, “The WGA reserves the right to assert that exploitation of writers\u2019 material to train AI is prohibited by [the contract] or other law.”<\/p>\n Currently, the legal relationship between large language models and copyrighted material is murky. But where federal and state law lags behind, the WGA’s bargaining agreement makes clear that union members do not consent to their work being used to train studios’ AIs.<\/p> "piano-inline-promo\"><\/div>\n The actors union, SAG-AFTRA, remains on strike, and on Monday, its members voted overwhelmingly "https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2023\/09\/26\/hollywood-strikes-could-soon-extend-to-the-video-game-industry\/\">to authorize a strike<\/a> against the video game industry as well. While bargaining on behalf of stunt, motion capture and voice actors in video games, SAG-AFTRA has also expressed concerns about how AI could be used to undermine union members’ creative work.<\/p>\n \u201cFor many performers, their first job may be their last, as companies become increasingly eager to scan our members or train AI with their voices as soon as they show up for work,\u201d reads the SAG-AFTRA\u00a0 "https:\/\/www.sagaftra.org\/get-involved\/take-action\/interactive-media-video-game-strike-authorization-2023\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" data-mrf-link=\"https:\/\/www.sagaftra.org\/get-involved\/take-action\/interactive-media-video-game-strike-authorization-2023\">website<\/a>.<\/p>\n It’s yet to be determined how the contract for SAG-AFTRA members will pan out, but the WGA’s agreement sets a precedent for establishing limitations against how AI can be used in creative professions.<\/p>\n "embed breakout embed-oembed embed--techcrunch\">\n "wp-embedded-content\" data-secret=\"B9VOCXXJJl\"> "https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2023\/09\/26\/hollywood-strikes-could-soon-extend-to-the-video-game-industry\/\">Hollywood strikes could soon extend to the video game industry<\/a><\/p><\/blockquote>\n "wp-embedded-content\" sandbox=\"allow-scripts\" security=\"restricted\" style=\"position: absolute; clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);\" title=\"“Hollywood strikes could soon extend to the video game industry” — TechCrunch\" src=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2023\/09\/26\/hollywood-strikes-could-soon-extend-to-the-video-game-industry\/embed\/#?secret=myiOGXKt9a#?secret=B9VOCXXJJl\" data-secret=\"B9VOCXXJJl\" width=\"800\" height=\"450\" frameborder=\"0\" marginwidth=\"0\" marginheight=\"0\" scrolling=\"no\"><\/iframe><\/div>\n","protected":false},"excerpt":{"rendered":" After almost five months, the Writers Guild of America (WGA) has reached an agreement with Hollywood studios to end the writers’ strike. Starting Wednesday, writers will be able to resume work under the conditions established by their new contract. During the historic strike, AI emerged as a key point of contention between the writers and […]<\/p>\n","protected":false},"author":133574468,"featured_media":2537578,"comment_status":"open","ping_status":"closed","sticky":false,"template":"","format":"standard","meta":{"amp_status":"","relegenceEntities":[],"relegenceSubjects":[],"carmot_uuid":"016bd865-c55b-3835-a1c8-aada8c1598d7","footnotes":"","apple_news_api_created_at":"2023-09-27T02:26:29Z","apple_news_api_id":"1c30fb30-efc4-478e-b113-869748026471","apple_news_api_modified_at":"2023-09-27T20:59:44Z","apple_news_api_revision":"AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAQ==","apple_news_api_share_url":"https:\/\/apple.news\/AHDD7MO_ER46xE4aXSAJkcQ","apple_news_coverimage":0,"apple_news_coverimage_caption":"","apple_news_is_hidden":false,"apple_news_is_paid":false,"apple_news_is_preview":false,"apple_news_is_sponsored":false,"apple_news_maturity_rating":"","apple_news_metadata":"\"\"","apple_news_pullquote":"","apple_news_pullquote_position":"","apple_news_slug":"","apple_news_sections":"\"\"","apple_news_suppress_video_url":false,"apple_news_use_image_component":false},"categories":[577047203,577030456],"tags":[14067,12374,577166642,219006,2089041],"crunchbase_tag":[],"tc_stories_tax":[],"tc_ec_category":[],"tc_event":[],"tc_regions_tax":[],"yoast_head":"\n The writers' strike is over; here's how AI negotiations shook out | TechCrunch<\/title>\n "description\" content=\"After almost five months, the Writers Guild of America (WGA) has reached an agreement with Hollywood studios to end the writers' strike. logo beheading twitter bird logo"},{"@type":"WebSite","@id":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/#website","url":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/","name":"TechCrunch","description":"Startup and Technology News","publisher":{"@id":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/#organization"},"alternateName":"TC","potentialAction":[{"@type":"SearchAction","target":{"@type":"EntryPoint","urlTemplate":"https:\/\/search.techcrunch.com\/search?p={search_term_string}"},"query-input":"required name=search_term_string"}],"inLanguage":"en-US"},{"@type":"Organization","@id":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/#organization","name":"TechCrunch","alternateName":"TC","url":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/","logo":{"@type":"ImageObject","inLanguage":"en-US","@id":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/#\/schema\/logo\/image\/","url":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/04\/tc-logo-2018-square-reverse2x.png?resize=1200,1200","contentUrl":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/04\/tc-logo-2018-square-reverse2x.png?resize=1200,1200","width":1200,"height":1200,"caption":"TechCrunch"},"image":{"@id":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/#\/schema\/logo\/image\/"},"sameAs":["https:\/\/www.facebook.com\/techcrunch","https:\/\/twitter.com\/TechCrunch","https:\/\/mstdn.social\/@TechCrunch","https:\/\/bsky.app\/profile\/techcrunch.bsky.social","https:\/\/www.threads.net\/@techcrunch"]}]}},"_links":{"self":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tags\/2089041"}],"collection":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tags"}],"about":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/taxonomies\/post_tag"}],"wp:post_type":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/posts?tags=2089041"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc_battlefield?tags=2089041"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc-media-gallery?tags=2089041"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc_unified_video?tags=2089041"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc_video?tags=2089041"}],"curies":[{"name":"wp","href":"https:\/\/api.w.org\/{rel}","templated":true}]}}],[],[],[],[],[]]}},{"id":2605794,"date":"2023-09-26T09:18:58","date_gmt":"2023-09-26T16:18:58","guid":{"rendered":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/?p=2605794"},"modified":"2023-09-26T13:38:05","modified_gmt":"2023-09-26T20:38:05","slug":"hollywood-strikes-could-soon-extend-to-the-video-game-industry","status":"publish","type":"post","link":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2023\/09\/26\/hollywood-strikes-could-soon-extend-to-the-video-game-industry\/","title":{"rendered":"Hollywood strikes could soon extend to the video game industry"},"content":{"rendered":" "speakable-summary\">SAG-AFTRA members voted overwhelmingly on Monday to authorize a strike against the video game industry. The union — which includes video game performers like voice, motion capture and stunt actors — has been negotiating a contract for over a year with a collection of studios, like Epic, EA, Activision and more. Around 27.47% of eligible voters cast a ballot to authorize the strike, representing 34,687 members, 98.32% of whom voted in the affirmative.<\/p>\n \u201cAfter five rounds of bargaining, it has become abundantly clear that the video game companies aren\u2019t willing to meaningfully engage on the critical issues: compensation undercut by inflation, unregulated use of AI and safety,\u201d said SAG-AFTRA National Executive Director Duncan Crabtree-Ireland in a "https:\/\/www.sagaftra.org\/sag-aftra-members-approve-video-game-strike-authorization-vote-9832-yes-vote\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">statement<\/a>.<\/p>\n The union is seeking increased safety measures on sets and vocal stress protections for voice actors, as well as wage increases consistent with inflation. But members see protections around AI consent, transparency and compensation to be vital to ensuring the future of their jobs.<\/p>\n “For many performers, their first job may be their last, as companies become increasingly eager to scan our members or train AI with their voices as soon as they show up for work,” reads the SAG-AFTRA "https:\/\/www.sagaftra.org\/get-involved\/take-action\/interactive-media-video-game-strike-authorization-2023\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">website<\/a>.<\/p>\n These same concerns are present among other Hollywood creatives. When the WGA launched its strike in May, screenwriters demanded clear guidelines regarding how AI could be used when scripting TV shows and movies.<\/p>\n A focal point of the writers’ strike — which is paused after the union reached a "https:\/\/apnews.com\/article\/writers-strike-deal-hollywood-wga-3336824c06795931845c889f1e08b3ff#:~:text=LOS%20ANGELES%20(AP)%20%E2%80%94%20The,could%20be%20near%20an%20end.\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">tentative agreement<\/a> with the AMPTP this weekend — was to adjust how writers are paid in an era when streaming is king, yet streaming residuals are dismal. But AI emerged as another big concern in the strike.<\/p>\n \u201cWhen we first put [the proposal] in, we thought we were covering our bases \u2014 you know, some of our members are worried about this, the area is moving quickly, we should get ahead of it,\u201d comedy writer Adam Conover told TechCrunch at the beginning of the "https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2023\/05\/03\/ai-replace-tv-writers-strike\/\">writers’ strike<\/a>. \u201cWe didn\u2019t think it\u2019d be a contentious issue because the fact of the matter is, the current state of the text-generation technology is completely incapable of writing any work that could be used in a production.”<\/p> "piano-inline-promo\"><\/div>\n Meanwhile, industry-side entrepreneurs don’t see their AI tools as threats to working artists.<\/p>\n “As of today, nobody has lost his job because of what we do,” "https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2023\/09\/25\/ai-writers-strike-film-industry\/\">said Ofir Krakowski<\/a>, co-founder and CEO at\u00a0 "https:\/\/deepdub.ai\/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" data-mrf-link=\"https:\/\/deepdub.ai\/\">deepdub.ai<\/a>, at "https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/events\/tc-disrupt-2023\/\">TechCrunch Disrupt<\/a>. The company automates the process of dubbing media in other languages. “Actually, most of our customers are looking to monetize on content that was not economically viable to monetize on. So we are enabling them to do more work.”<\/p>\n Spotify announced a "https:\/\/www.theverge.com\/2023\/9\/25\/23888009\/spotify-podcast-translation-voice-replication-open-ai\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">similar feature<\/a> this week, which allows podcasters to use AI to dub their podcasts in other languages, using their own voice. But across the industry, creatives have raised concerns about how these kinds of features work, whether they train on data without creators’ consent, and how they could be used to spread "https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2023\/09\/21\/how-generative-ai-is-accelerating-disinformation\/\">AI-powered misinformation<\/a>.<\/p>\n The strike won’t take effect if the bargaining parties can reach an agreement in this week’s bargaining session. In a statement to the "https:\/\/www.hollywoodreporter.com\/business\/business-news\/sag-aftra-members-authorize-video-game-strike-1235598617\/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Hollywood Reporter<\/a>, a spokesperson for the Interactive Media Agreement said: “We will continue to negotiate in good faith to reach an agreement that reflects the important contributions of SAG-AFTRA-represented performers in video games. We have reached tentative agreements on over half of the proposals and are optimistic we can find a resolution at the bargaining table.”<\/p>\n "embed breakout embed-oembed embed--techcrunch\">\n "wp-embedded-content\" data-secret=\"7lgqctRvCq\"> "https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2023\/05\/03\/ai-replace-tv-writers-strike\/\">AI can’t replace human writers<\/a><\/p><\/blockquote>\n "wp-embedded-content\" sandbox=\"allow-scripts\" security=\"restricted\" style=\"position: absolute; clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);\" title=\"“AI can’t replace human writers” — TechCrunch\" src=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2023\/05\/03\/ai-replace-tv-writers-strike\/embed\/#?secret=KUYSDmsLdU#?secret=7lgqctRvCq\" data-secret=\"7lgqctRvCq\" width=\"800\" height=\"450\" frameborder=\"0\" marginwidth=\"0\" marginheight=\"0\" scrolling=\"no\"><\/iframe><\/div>\n "embed breakout embed-oembed embed--techcrunch\">\n "wp-embedded-content\" data-secret=\"GaZ7ee3dmD\"> "https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2023\/09\/25\/ai-writers-strike-film-industry\/\">‘Nobody has lost their job because of what we do,’ says CEO of film industry AI tool<\/a><\/p><\/blockquote>\n "wp-embedded-content\" sandbox=\"allow-scripts\" security=\"restricted\" style=\"position: absolute; clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);\" title=\"“‘Nobody has lost their job because of what we do,’ says CEO of film industry AI tool” — TechCrunch\" src=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2023\/09\/25\/ai-writers-strike-film-industry\/embed\/#?secret=hOw8Ojy9jW#?secret=GaZ7ee3dmD\" data-secret=\"GaZ7ee3dmD\" width=\"800\" height=\"450\" frameborder=\"0\" marginwidth=\"0\" marginheight=\"0\" scrolling=\"no\"><\/iframe><\/div>\n","protected":false},"excerpt":{"rendered":" SAG-AFTRA members voted overwhelmingly on Monday to authorize a strike against the video game industry. The union — which includes video game performers like voice, motion capture and stunt actors — has been negotiating a contract for over a year with a collection of studios, like Epic, EA, Activision and more. Around 27.47% of eligible News","publisher":{"@id":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/#organization"},"alternateName":"TC","potentialAction":[{"@type":"SearchAction","target":{"@type":"EntryPoint","urlTemplate":"https:\/\/search.techcrunch.com\/search?p={search_term_string}"},"query-input":"required name=search_term_string"}],"inLanguage":"en-US"},{"@type":"Organization","@id":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/#organization","name":"TechCrunch","alternateName":"TC","url":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/","logo":{"@type":"ImageObject","inLanguage":"en-US","@id":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/#\/schema\/logo\/image\/","url":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/04\/tc-logo-2018-square-reverse2x.png?resize=1200,1200","contentUrl":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/04\/tc-logo-2018-square-reverse2x.png?resize=1200,1200","width":1200,"height":1200,"caption":"TechCrunch"},"image":{"@id":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/#\/schema\/logo\/image\/"},"sameAs":["https:\/\/www.facebook.com\/techcrunch","https:\/\/twitter.com\/TechCrunch","https:\/\/mstdn.social\/@TechCrunch","https:\/\/bsky.app\/profile\/techcrunch.bsky.social","https:\/\/www.threads.net\/@techcrunch"]}]}},"_links":{"self":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tags\/1914"}],"collection":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tags"}],"about":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/taxonomies\/post_tag"}],"wp:post_type":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/posts?tags=1914"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc_battlefield?tags=1914"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc-media-gallery?tags=1914"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc_unified_video?tags=1914"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc_video?tags=1914"}],"curies":[{"name":"wp","href":"https:\/\/api.w.org\/{rel}","templated":true}]}}],[],[],[],[],[]]}},{"id":2605202,"date":"2023-09-25T10:12:45","date_gmt":"2023-09-25T17:12:45","guid":{"rendered":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/?p=2605202"},"modified":"2023-09-25T13:20:19","modified_gmt":"2023-09-25T20:20:19","slug":"reddit-will-start-paying-you-real-money-for-your-karma","status":"publish","type":"post","link":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2023\/09\/25\/reddit-will-start-paying-you-real-money-for-your-karma\/","title":{"rendered":"Reddit will start paying you real money for good posts"},"content":{"rendered":" "speakable-summary\">Reddit announced a "https:\/\/www.reddit.com\/contributor-program\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">contributor program<\/a> on Monday, which awards users actual, real money for their fake internet points. Now, eligible users will be able to convert their Reddit gold and karma into fiat currency (no, not "https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2022\/10\/18\/redditors-have-created-millions-of-crypto-wallets-to-buy-nft-avatars\/\">crypto<\/a>), which is disbursed once per month.<\/p>\n So far, the Reddit contributor program is limited to users in the United States (to start, at least) who are over the age of 18 and can verify their identity via Persona and Stripe. Accounts must have existed for over 30 days, and only safe for work posts can be monetized.<\/p>\n This feature was leaked about two months ago in "https:\/\/www.androidauthority.com\/reddit-contributor-program-3343397\/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Android Authority<\/a>, when a reverse engineer found data about the program in an APK teardown.<\/p>\n A user’s Reddit karma (or number of upvotes received) dictates how much money they can earn. To withdraw money, redditors need to earn at least 10 gold within a 30-day period — if they don’t reach the threshold, the balance rolls over. For users with between 100 and 4,999 karma, they will receive $0.90 per 1 gold. Once you earn more than 5,000 karma, you can earn $1 per gold.<\/p>\n Twitter (now called X) launched a similar creator monetization program recently, where some creators can "https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2023\/07\/13\/twitter-starts-sharing-ad-revenue-with-verified-creators\/\">earn ad revenue<\/a> based on the impressions their posts generate. But there are concerns that programs like this can incentivize spammy posting, or “engagement bait.”<\/p>\n Reddit is also changing its system for awarding gold. Users previously could buy coins, which could then be used to buy gold or other awards, which can be given out to high-quality posts. But Reddit sunsetted the awards and coins system to make gold more straightforward. Now, you can long-press the upvote icon in the app, or hover over it on desktop, to buy gold — prices start at $1.99 for one gold, and go up to $49.00 for 25 gold. So, if top users earn $1.00 per gold, this means that Reddit retains around 50% of the payment. While these features will start rolling out on the app, they won’t be available on web until later this year.<\/p>\n These revamped payment programs arrive at a time when Reddit is in tumult, as parts of its user base still "https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2023\/07\/20\/redditors-are-already-using-r-place-to-address-api-controversy\/\">remain hostile<\/a> due to controversial API changes, which make it "https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2023\/05\/31\/popular-reddit-app-apollo-may-go-out-of-business-over-reddits-new-unaffordable-api-pricing\/\">unaffordable<\/a> for many developers to build on Reddit. Popular third-party apps like "https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2023\/06\/08\/popular-third-party-reddit-app-apollo-is-shutting-down-as-a-result-of-reddits-new-api-pricing\/\">Apollo<\/a>, "https:\/\/www.theverge.com\/2023\/6\/8\/23754616\/reddit-third-party-apps-api-shutdown-rif-reddplanet-sync\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Reddit is Fun<\/a>, "https:\/\/www.reddit.com\/r\/ReddPlanet\/comments\/144glbz\/an_unfortunate_goodbye\/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">ReddPlanet<\/a> and "https:\/\/www.reddit.com\/r\/redditsync\/comments\/144jp3w\/sync_will_shut_down_on_june_30_2023\/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Sync<\/a> have shut down after these changes.<\/p> "piano-inline-promo\"><\/div>\n Update, 9\/25\/23, 1:55 PM ET with additional information about payments.<\/em><\/p>\n "embed breakout embed-oembed embed--techcrunch\">\n "wp-embedded-content\" data-secret=\"Xhor1jYBBY\"> "https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2023\/06\/14\/hundreds-of-subreddits-plan-to-go-dark-indefinitely-after-reddit-ceos-internal-memo\/\">Hundreds of subreddits plan to go dark indefinitely after Reddit CEO’s internal memo<\/a><\/p><\/blockquote>\n "wp-embedded-content\" sandbox=\"allow-scripts\" security=\"restricted\" style=\"position: absolute; clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);\" title=\"“Hundreds of subreddits plan to go dark indefinitely after Reddit CEO’s internal memo” — TechCrunch\" src=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2023\/06\/14\/hundreds-of-subreddits-plan-to-go-dark-indefinitely-after-reddit-ceos-internal-memo\/embed\/#?secret=Y1kA6tMdK5#?secret=Xhor1jYBBY\" data-secret=\"Xhor1jYBBY\" width=\"800\" height=\"450\" frameborder=\"0\" marginwidth=\"0\" marginheight=\"0\" scrolling=\"no\"><\/iframe><\/div>\n","protected":false},"excerpt":{"rendered":" Reddit announced a contributor program on Monday, which awards users actual, real money for their fake internet points. Now, eligible users will be able to convert their Reddit gold and karma into fiat currency (no, not crypto), which is disbursed once per month. So far, the Reddit contributor program is limited to users in the […]<\/p>\n","protected":false},"author":133574468,"featured_media":1797987,"comment_status":"open","ping_status":"closed","sticky":false,"template":"","format":"standard","meta":{"amp_status":"","relegenceEntities":[],"relegenceSubjects":[],"carmot_uuid":"8a53b770-d695-3303-8b90-a722b9bc4dcd","footnotes":"","apple_news_api_created_at":"2023-09-25T17:12:52Z","apple_news_api_id":"f2e53039-0c6f-4e1a-818d-83a417d15d78","apple_news_api_modified_at":"2023-09-25T20:19:37Z","apple_news_api_revision":"AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAg==","apple_news_api_share_url":"https:\/\/apple.news\/A8uUwOQxvThqBjYOkF9FdeA","apple_news_coverimage":0,"apple_news_coverimage_caption":"","apple_news_is_hidden":false,"apple_news_is_paid":false,"apple_news_is_preview":false,"apple_news_is_sponsored":false,"apple_news_maturity_rating":"","apple_news_metadata":"\"\"","apple_news_pullquote":"","apple_news_pullquote_position":"","apple_news_slug":"","apple_news_sections":"\"\"","apple_news_suppress_video_url":false,"apple_news_use_image_component":false},"categories":[577051039,577055593],"tags":[576849806,40179,49818],"crunchbase_tag":[],"tc_stories_tax":[],"tc_ec_category":[],"tc_event":[],"tc_regions_tax":[],"yoast_head":"\n Reddit will start paying you real money for good posts | TechCrunch<\/title>\n "description\" content=\"Reddit announced a contributor program on Monday, which awards users actual, real money for their fake internet points. on-worlds-is-rolling-out-on-web-and-mobile\/","title":{"rendered":"Meta’s Horizon Worlds is rolling out on web and mobile"},"content":{"rendered":" "speakable-summary\">After more than a year and a half in "https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2022\/04\/15\/meta-developing-web-version-horizon-worlds\/\">development<\/a>, Meta is bringing Horizon Worlds out of the headset. The VR social app has started rolling out for some users on web and mobile in early access, Meta "https:\/\/www.meta.com\/blog\/quest\/horizon-worlds-web-mobile-social-vr-free\/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">said<\/a>.<\/p>\n By expanding to mobile and web, Horizon Worlds can cater to a much larger user base, instead of only users with a Quest VR headset. But if the platform isn’t enjoyable, it won’t matter how many devices it can be played on.<\/p>\n Meta has never released any user numbers for the VR version of Horizon Worlds, but "https:\/\/www.wsj.com\/articles\/meta-metaverse-horizon-worlds-zuckerberg-facebook-internal-documents-11665778961\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">reports have shown<\/a> that the platform is not very populated.<\/p>\n In the game, players embody their virtual avatar and can "https:\/\/www.meta.com\/blog\/quest\/super-rumble-horizon-worlds-titanborne\/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">play games<\/a> and hang out in “worlds,” which are made either by Meta or from users themselves. Users can also create items to sell, but Meta takes a "https:\/\/www.cnbc.com\/2022\/04\/13\/meta-plans-to-take-a-nearly-50percent-cut-on-nft-sales-in-its-metaverse.html\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">47.5% cut of sales<\/a>.<\/p>\n Earlier this year, Horizon Worlds "https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2023\/04\/18\/meta-opens-up-its-social-vr-platform-horizon-worlds-to-teens\/\">opened to teenage users<\/a>, a decision that Senators Richard Blumenthal (D-CT) and Ed Markey (D-MA) decried. Teenage users automatically are set to the “garbled voices” setting, which changes the voices of people a teen doesn’t know into gibberish.<\/p>\n Most importantly, yes, Meta is "https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2023\/08\/29\/meta-avatars-are-finally-getting-legs-in-beta\/\">working on giving avatars legs<\/a>.<\/p>\n "embed breakout embed-oembed embed--techcrunch\">\n "wp-embedded-content\" data-secret=\"OkFlZlQ1o0\"> "https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2022\/04\/15\/meta-developing-web-version-horizon-worlds\/\">Meta is developing a web version of Horizon Worlds<\/a><\/p><\/blockquote> "piano-inline-promo\"><\/div>\n "wp-embedded-content\" sandbox=\"allow-scripts\" security=\"restricted\" style=\"position: absolute; clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);\" title=\"“Meta is developing a web version of Horizon Worlds” — TechCrunch\" src=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2022\/04\/15\/meta-developing-web-version-horizon-worlds\/embed\/#?secret=rUl7bogWC2#?secret=OkFlZlQ1o0\" data-secret=\"OkFlZlQ1o0\" width=\"800\" height=\"450\" frameborder=\"0\" marginwidth=\"0\" marginheight=\"0\" scrolling=\"no\"><\/iframe><\/div>\n "embed breakout embed-oembed embed--techcrunch\">\n "wp-embedded-content\" data-secret=\"6d4gsNACYc\"> "https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2022\/04\/11\/meta-horizon-worlds-creator-monetization-in-app-purchases\/\">Meta’s Horizon Worlds is testing in-app purchases and creator bonuses<\/a><\/p><\/blockquote>\n "wp-embedded-content\" sandbox=\"allow-scripts\" security=\"restricted\" style=\"position: absolute; clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);\" title=\"“Meta’s Horizon Worlds is testing in-app purchases and creator bonuses” — TechCrunch\" src=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2022\/04\/11\/meta-horizon-worlds-creator-monetization-in-app-purchases\/embed\/#?secret=QEuKxlOiCO#?secret=6d4gsNACYc\" data-secret=\"6d4gsNACYc\" width=\"800\" height=\"450\" frameborder=\"0\" marginwidth=\"0\" marginheight=\"0\" scrolling=\"no\"><\/iframe><\/div>\n","protected":false},"excerpt":{"rendered":" After more than a year and a half in development, Meta is bringing Horizon Worlds out of the headset.
